I am trying to install cantera 1.7.0 on core 2 duo computer with 64
bit SuS=
e 10.2.
1.I found that if I use external lapack, blas libraries optimised b=
y
ATLAS i obtain the following error:

-> gcc -c  -I/home/sergey/src/canter=
a-1.7.0/build/include
-I/usr/local/matlab/extern/include

-fno-omit-frame-pointer -ansi -D=

tlab/extern/src/mexversion.c

-> g++ -O -pthread -shared

rf.o): relocation R_X86_64_32
against `a local symbol' can not be used when=
 making a shared object;
recompile with -fPIC

=

Unabl=
e to complete successfully.

mex -v private/c=
tmethods.cpp private/ctfunctions.cpp ...

Error in =3D=3D> setup at 2
build=
ux

This error was obtain despite compiling LAPACK, BLAS and ATLAS with
-fP=
IC flag.
  
2.This error disappear when I use internal LAPACK libraries.
3.=
I could not compile correctly numarray for suse 10.2. binary rpm
also gives=
 errors with testall.test() in numarray. So I used numeric
in cantera.
4.No=
w make finished without errors. However make install produce the
following =
error: 

cd cantera; /usr/bin/install -c *.m *.mexglx
/usr/local/cantera/ma=
tlab/toolbox/cantera/cantera
/usr/bin/install: cannot stat `*.mexglx': No s=
uch file or directory
make[1]: *** [install] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving direc=
tory `/home/sergey/src/cantera-1.7.0/Cantera/matlab'
make: *** [matlab-inst=
all] Error 2

Thus, matlab interface probably does not work, however many p=
ython
examples work OK. Many but not all: for example adiabatic_flame.py an=
d
fixed_T_flame.py  give segmentation fault.
